location: The same. A  street near the gate.

lines.text: Enter SICINIUS, BRUTUS, and an AEdile

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Bid them all home; he's gone, and we'll no further. The nobility are vex'd, whom we see have sided In his behalf.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Now we have shown our power, Let us seem humbler after it is done Than when it was a-doing.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Bid them home: Say their great enemy is gone, and they Stand in their ancient strength.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Dismiss them home. Here comes his mother.
Exit AEdile

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Let's not meet her.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: They say she's mad.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: They have ta'en note of us: keep on your way.
Enter VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, and MENENIUS

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: O, ye're well met: the hoarded plague o' the gods Requite your love!

lines.speaker: menenius
lines.text: Peace, peace; be not so loud.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: If that I could for weeping, you should hear,-- Nay, and you shall hear some. Will you be gone?
To BRUTUS

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: [To SICINIUS]  You shall stay too: I would I had the power To say so to my husband.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Are  you mankind?

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Ay, fool; is that a shame? Note but this fool. Was not a man my father? Hadst thou foxship To banish him that struck more blows for Rome Than thou hast spoken words?

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: O blessed heavens!

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: More noble blows than ever thou wise words; And for Rome's good. I'll tell thee what; yet go: Nay, but thou shalt stay too: I would my son Were in Arabia, and thy tribe before him, His good sword in his hand.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: What then?

lines.speaker: virgilia
lines.text: What then! He'ld make an end of thy posterity.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Bastards and all. Good man, the wounds that he does bear for Rome!

lines.speaker: menenius
lines.text: Come, come, peace.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: I would he had continued to his country As he began, and not unknit himself The noble knot he made.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: I would he had.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: 'I would he had'! 'Twas you incensed the rabble: Cats, that can judge as fitly of his worth As I can of those mysteries which heaven Will not have earth to know.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Pray, let us go.

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Now, pray, sir, get you gone: You have done a brave deed. Ere you go, hear this:-- As far as doth the Capitol exceed The meanest house in Rome, so far my son-- This lady's husband here, this, do you see-- Whom you have banish'd, does exceed you all.

lines.speaker: brutus
lines.text: Well, well, we'll leave you.

lines.speaker: sicinius
lines.text: Why stay we to be baited With one that wants her wits?

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Take my prayers with you. I would the gods had nothing else to do But to confirm my curses! Could I meet 'em But once a-day, it would unclog my heart Of what lies heavy to't.
Exeunt Tribunes

lines.speaker: menenius
lines.text: You have told them home; And, by my troth, you have cause. You'll sup with me?

lines.speaker: volumnia
lines.text: Anger's my meat; I sup upon myself, And so shall starve with feeding. Come, let's go: Leave this faint puling and lament as I do, In anger, Juno-like. Come, come, come.

lines.speaker: menenius
lines.text: Fie, fie, fie!
Exeunt
